instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Mid 2014 Random auto shut-down
threads.message:
- MLB was liquid damaged initially with auto shut-down issue
- MLB side KBD backlight connector, PowerGUD section and Thunderbolt section were affected
- Cleaned affected areas and replaced couple of burnt/corroded components
- Ran ASD EFI before completing repair, test passed
- After a month, the device developed same issue. Inspected MLB under microscope, clean
- Ran ASD EFI, found 3 errors. Result screen shot attached below

Need help in fixing this.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Mid 2014 Random auto shut-down
threads.message: Start changing FDMF6808N chips, like any <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board...
